assignments.summary: This university assignment provides instructions and resources for a lesson on heaps, including a PDF with instructions, readings from Chapter 6 of the book "CLRS" on Heapsort, and several lecture videos on topics such as priority queues, introduction to heaps, heap operations, and Heapsort, with accompanying slides. assignments.name: HW9
assignments.description:
This is an individual assignment - do not show your work or any solutions to your peers in any section of CSCI 341, only discuss concepts and ideas, per the CS@Mines Collaboration Policy. Please visit office hours for assistance or arrange a time to meet an instructor or TA.

Download homework problems in PDF format and follow the instructions within it.  A txt file containing outputs of public test cases is also provided. Please save your file and name it hw9.s.

Submit your completed homework using the link below that will take you to Gradescope.
assignments.summary: This is an individual university assignment for a CSCI 341 course. Students are expected to work alone and only discuss concepts and ideas with peers, following the CS@Mines Collaboration Policy. The assignment involves downloading homework problems in PDF format and following the instructions within. A txt file with public test case outputs is also provided. Students must save their completed work in a file named "hw9.s" and submit it through Gradescope. Assistance is available through office hours or by arranging a meeting with an instructor or TA.

assignments.name: Reading Week 12
assignments.description:
Chapter 9  (Pg. 480-537)
9.1  Introduction
9.2  Payback Period Analysis
9.3  Savings Are Analogous to Income 
9.4  Sunk Costs and Opportunity Costs 
9.5  Breakeven Analyses
9.6  Three Methods of Investment Valuation 
9.7  NPV Use for Breakeven Acquisition Cost Valuation 
9.7a NPV Use for Breakeven Sale Value Analysis 
9.8  Valuation of Public Projects and Investments 
9.9  Cash Flow Versus Shareholder Reporting and Net Income
9.10  Net Income Criteria Compared to Cash Flow Criteria
9.10a Value Added

Chapter 10 (Pg. 551-575)

10.1 General Replacement Philosophy
10.2 Leasing Compared to Purchasing
10.3 Sunk Costs and Opportunity Costs Related to Replacement
assignments.summary: The university assignment appears to cover chapters 9 and 10 of a textbook, focusing on financial analysis and investment valuation. Chapter 9 covers topics such as payback period analysis, breakeven analyses, and three methods of investment valuation, as well as the valuation of public projects and investments. Chapter 10 discusses general replacement philosophy, leasing compared to purchasing, and sunk costs and opportunity costs related to replacement, indicating that the assignment may be related to a course in engineering economics, finance, or a related field.

assignments.name: Amazon Pays No Tax "Write to Learn"
assignments.description:
Watch the following video and then write two observations and a question.

 

https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/03/why-amazon-paid-no-federal-income-tax.html 

 

Please put thought into your observations and question as this is a graded activity.  One page maximum for your two observations and question.

 

You will be peer reviewing three other peoples response.  Please respond to each persons observations as well as try to answer their question.  Your grade however will come from your submission, and not the peer review.
assignments.summary: The assignment requires students to watch a video and then write two observations and a question based on the content. The video appears to be related to a CNBC article about why Amazon paid no federal income tax. Students are asked to be thoughtful in their observations and question, and their submission should be no more than one page. Additionally, students will be required to peer review the responses of three other students, responding to their observations and attempting to answer their question, although their grade will be based solely on their own submission.

assignments.name: HW10
assignments.description:
This is an individual assignment - do not show your work or any solutions to your peers in any section of CSCI 341, only discuss concepts and ideas, per the CS@Mines Collaboration Policy Download CS@Mines Collaboration PolicyDownload CS@Mines Collaboration PolicyDownload CS@Mines Collaboration Policy. Please visit office hours for assistance or arrange a time to meet an instructor or TA.

Download homework problems in PDF Download PDFor WORD Download WORDformat and follow the instructions within it.

It's fine to handwrite & scan your work, just keep it legible. Make sure your name is on the pages submitted.  Please use the same number of pages as the PDF file and each page should have the same problems as the PDF file.

Please create a PDF named CSCI341_HW10_YourName.pdf, replacing "YourName" with your name -- i.e., if Susan Jones were submitting work, she would create and submit CSCI341_HW10_SusanJones.pdf.

Submit your completed homework using the link below that will take you to Gradescope.
assignments.summary: This is an individual assignment for the CSCI 341 course, and students are instructed not to share their work or solutions with peers. They should download the homework problems in either PDF or Word format and follow the instructions within. Students can handwrite and scan their work as long as it's legible, and they should include their name on the pages submitted. The completed homework should be saved as a PDF with a specific filename format (CSCI341_HW10_YourName.pdf) and submitted through the Gradescope link provided.

assignments.name: In-Class Quiz After-Tax
assignments.description:
The quiz will happen on one class period this week.  

The following quiz has five questions.  The final question contains our in-class problem we are going to work.  Please answer the first four basic tax questions and then download the file in question 5.  Remember to submit your quiz after you download the file.
assignments.summary: The university assignment is a quiz that will take place during one class period and consists of five questions. The first four questions are basic tax questions, and the fifth question involves downloading a file and working on an in-class problem. Students are required to answer the first four questions, download the file for the fifth question, and then submit their quiz.

assignments.name: Exam 2
assignments.description:
Exam 2 is a common (evening) exam.

Date: Tuesday, April 8

Time: 7:00 - 8:30pm

Exam rooms (same as Exam 1):

Sections C, D (M/W class days): Green Center Metals Hall

Sections A, B (T/R class days): CTLM 102

Exam 2 will cover Sections 2.4, 2.5, 2.6, 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, and 3.4.

Homeworks 7 (#5 and #6) and HW 8, 9, 10, and 11 cover Exam 2 material.

Formula sheet: M334_Exam2_FormulaSheet.pdf will be provided with Exam 2.

Review problems: PracticeProblems_Ch2_Ch3_334.pdf

Review session Monday, April 7, 5:00 - 7:30 (room TBA).
assignments.summary: The university assignment is for Exam 2, scheduled to take place on Tuesday, April 8, from 7:00 to 8:30 pm. The exam will cover sections 2.4, 2.5, 2.6, 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, and 3.4, with relevant homework assignments being 7, 8, 9, 10, and 11. A formula sheet will be provided during the exam, and review problems are available for practice. Additionally, a review session is planned for Monday, April 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 pm, with the room to be announced. Students are assigned to different exam rooms based on their class days, with Sections C and D in Green Center Metals Hall and Sections A and B in CTLM 102.

assignments.summary: The university assignment involves reading chapters 9, 10, and 11 (pages 601-639) of a textbook. The specific topics to focus on include sunk costs and opportunity costs, breakeven analysis, NPV used for breakeven acquisition, replacement considerations, and leverage applications such as joint venture analysis and leveraged investment analysis, as well as current U.S. tax law regarding interest deductions.

assignments.name: HW#10 - Track Homework
assignments.description:
Homework #10 is a track Homework and in fact is the same homework as HW#4 but after-tax.  

You MUST use the same homework you choose for HW#4.  If you switch problems you will receive a zero.

Each problem statement has had the necessary tax details added to the problem.  For each and every problem the deductions will start in the year the cost is incurred and the company has "other income".

Your model should balance, check Rule #4!

HW#10 Aerospace.pdf

HW#10 General.pdf

HW#10 Mining.pdf

HW#10 Oil and Gas.pdf

HW#10 Technology.pdf
assignments.summary: Homework #10 is a track homework that is the same as Homework #4 but with after-tax considerations. Students must use the same homework they chose for HW#4, and switching problems will result in a zero. The problem statements have been updated with tax details, and deductions will start in the year the cost is incurred, with the company having "other income." Students are reminded to ensure their model balances, as per Rule #4. The homework problems are available in various industry-specific PDF files, including Aerospace, General, Mining, Oil and Gas, and Technology.

plan: This is a groq summarized text! I hope you plan to follow it!
